result.execSummary:
The defendant Saviano Phillip Frais was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not already done.
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge.  To be paid by 12/31/15.  Any remaning balance will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any sentence.  Credit for six days, April 6-11, 2014.  Time served.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Saviano Phillip Frais

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Saviano Phillip Frais in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
State files insert regarding case 11CM6839, received and filed.
Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant. 
Court ordered defendant to serve 6 DAYS, in the House of Correction consecutive to any sentence; credit for 6 days (April 6-11, 2014); TIME SERVED.
-Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not already done.
-Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including
  the DNA surcharge, by 12-31-2015. Any remaining balance will become immediately due
  or civil judgment to be entered. 


Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 
Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated January 26, 2015, received and filed.

Court is in a Jury Trial on another matter. Spin Court is available. Off the record, the Defense Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court accepts the substitution against Judge Konkol.

Defendant Saviano Phillip Frais in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Sentencing Hearing. Case held off the record as the Court is in a Jury Trial on another matter. No additional spin courts are available, case is adjourned for Sentencing on 1-27-2015 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated December 8, 2014, received and filed.

Defendant Saviano Phillip Frais in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Danielle Chojnacki for Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for Plea and Sentencing. Case proceeds to Plea Hearing. 
On or motion of the State, Court ordered charge amended to Possession of THC , contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section 961.41(3g)(e), a Misdemeanor.
AS TO COUNT 1 of the Oral Amended Charge - 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Case is adjourned for Sentencing on 12-9-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for December 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Saviano Phillip Frais in court with attorney Darryl E. Smith.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for Motion Hearing. For the reasons placed on the record the Defense does not withdraw motion, and the Court is not making a ruling on the motion at this time. 
Defense requests case be set for Plea and Sentencing. Court orders case adjourned for Plea and Sentencing on 10-24-2014 at 8:30 a.m., Br. 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Report dated September 15, 2014, received and filed.

Attorney Darryl E. Smith in court, defendant Saviano Phillip Frais not in court, in custody.  Patricia I. Daugherty appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Deputy Court Clerk: alp   Court in jury trial this date; case rescheduled.  Parties advised that effective 8-3-14, case will be reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17 in room 313 of the safety building.  Motion hearing scheduled for 09-16-2014 at 01:30 pm.
Filed by the State:  Response to Defendant's Motion to Suppress Physical Evidence - Seizure of the Defendant.  alp
Filed by the defense:  Motion to Suppress Physical Evidence - Illegal Seizure of Defendant.  alp

Defendant Saviano Phillip Frais in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Hanna R Kolberg appeared for Paul Hauer for the State of Wisconsin. Defense requesting a Stop Motion hearing. Case adjourned for a Stop Motion Hearing in Branch 26.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 22, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Defendant Saviano Phillip Frais in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Danielle E Chojnacki appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 9, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Saviano Phillip Frais in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Defendant Saviano Phillip Frais in custody.  Step Nolten for Paul M Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge William Pocan, Branch 26.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 22, 2014 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia and no alcohol.   Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Saviano Phillip Frais in court with attorney Darryl E Smith.  Defendant Saviano Phillip Frais in custody.  Paul L Tiffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Pocan, Branch 26. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 21, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
